resource.name: City Bonus Codes
resource.description:
A listing of the different "bonus codes" that supplement the pay of City employees, not including DWP. DWP Pay Codes are available here: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Payroll/Department-of-Water-and-Power-DWP-Pay-Codes/jwzw-nd84

The Category field indicates which column of the Payroll dataset (https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Payroll/Payroll/8hc2-qe2x) that particular pay code relates to. Pay codes are governed by the Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs) between the City and its labor representatives; State, City and Federal law; and Departmental policy.

resource.name: City Employee Locations By Department
resource.description: A listing of the number of City employees in each zip code, by Department. Data current as of December 31, 2013, and reflects addresses provided by employees to the City's Payroll system. Employee-entered zip codes flagged as errors are set by default to coordinates (39.52368635500045, -99.11415045099966).
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Zip Codes' (b5dh-k22n) the point in column 'location_1' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

resource.name: Debt: Estimated Debt Service Requirements
resource.description: Provides the debt service requirements for fiscal years 2018-2020.
resource.attribution: Office of the Controller - City of Los Angeles

resource.name: Net Position by Category
resource.description:
CAFR Pages 330-331.

Net Position is the difference between the City’s assets and liabilities, including deferred outflows/inflows of resources. This data summarizes Net Position by Activity Types, Asset Type Groups, and Asset Types. This data is based on the following parameters: Accrual Basis of Accounting, Last Ten Fiscal Years and (amounts expressed in thousands).
columns_description: Fiscal Year (FY) is the time period for the City budget which begins on July 1 of a calendar year and ends on June 30 of the following year.
Net Position (Assets minus Liabilities) in Thousands of Dollars

Governmental Activities are functions principally supported by taxes and intergovernmental revenues. Business-Type Activities are functions intended to recover all (or in large part) costs through user fees and charges. Primary Government is a combination of Governmental and Business-Type Activities.
Type of asset the City owns
Grouping of Asset Types

resource.name: Small Business Emergency Microloans
resource.description: The City of Los Angeles created the Small Business Emergency Microloan Program in March 2020 to distribute $11 million to local businesses that are not eligible for federal CARES Act funds. L.A. Controller Ron Galperin, in coordination with Economic and Workforce Development Department (EWDD), created a Microloan Tracker to ensure public accountability and give Angelenos access to up-to-date information on how the City is supporting the local economy. Use this dataset to find microloan recipients or visit https://lacontroller.org/data-stories-and-maps/microloans/ to view a map of microloan recipients.

resource.name: Changes in Net Position
resource.description:
CAFR Pages 332-335.

Net Position is the difference between the City’s assets and liabilities, including deferred outflows/inflows of resources. This data summarizes the change in Net Position by Change Types, Asset Types, and Activities. This data is based on the following parameters: Accrual Basis of Accounting, Last Ten Fiscal Years and (amounts expressed in thousands).
columns_description: Type of outflows/inflows to the Net Position (Assets minus Liabilities)
Changes in Net Position (Assets minus Liabilities) in Thousands of Dollars

Governmental Activities are functions principally supported by taxes and intergovernmental revenues. Business-Type Activities are functions intended to recover all (or in large part) costs through user fees and charges. Special Items are those that are not Governmental or Business-type Activities.
Fiscal Year (FY) is the time period for the City budget which begins on July 1 of a calendar year and ends on June 30 of the following year.
Absolute Value of changes in Net Position (Assets minus Liabilities) in Thousands of Dollars

resource.name: Publicly-Owned Properties
resource.description:
This dataset contains all properties in the City of Los Angeles owned by the following public entities: Federal GSD, State of California, Los Angeles County, City of Los Angeles, LAUSD, and Metro. 

This data on property ownership was derived from the data made available by the Los Angeles County Assessor's Office, here: https://data.lacounty.gov/Parcel-/Assessor-Publicly-Owned-Parcels-Listing/a9jw-tqfp/data

resource.name: Neighborhood Council Monthly Expenditure Report For Fiscal Year 2021-Current
columns_description: Credit card transaction is billed as "Electronic" and the "Check" is issued by check

There are 4 types of status for a check: 1) "Active" means the check is still outstanding; 2) "Reconciled / Paid Check" indicates the check has been cleared by the bank; 3) "Reissued" means the check may be lost in the mail and not received by the vendor. The neighborhood council reissued a new check. The check marked reissued normally voided; And 4) "Void" states the check is cancelled. Usually credit card transactions would not have a status, and therefore labeled as "N/A" or being blank.

resource.name: Neighborhood Council Checking Account Expenditures for Fiscal Year 2016
resource.description:
For expenditures prior to July 1, 2014, please visit this dataset: http://controllerdata.lacity.org/resource/f2ec-m4t9

Beginning in 2014, each Neighborhood Council has been given a checking account as part of a new funding model for NC's. This dataset contains the information about each Neighborhood Council's expenditures from those checking accounts. For more information, see the User Guide here: http://empowerla.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/NC-Checking-Account-Core-Guide-7-1-14-1.pdf

resource.name: March 1 Revenue Forecast Report 2019
resource.description:
The Revenue Forecast Report for the City of Los Angeles provides a current and updated revenue estimate for fiscal year 2017-18 and revenue projections for fiscal year 2018-19.
Also included are the estimated requirements for debt service and General Fund cash flow borrowing. The Forecast is issued pursuant to the Controller’s City Charter mandate to monitor and report on all matters relating to the City’s fiscal health, to keep the City’s official financial records, and to supervise expenditures of the City.

resource.name: Salary Rate for Elected Officials
resource.description: Salary rate for elected officials is determined per Charter Section 218, which states that "a Council Member's salary is equal to salary prescribed by law for judges of Municipal Court of LA Judicial District or its successor."  It further stipulates that the City Controller gets 10% more than Council Member (CM), City Attorney gets 20% more than CM and the Mayor gets 30% more than CM.

resource.name: Department of Water and Power (DWP) Pay Codes
resource.description:
Data since July 1, 2014. This dataset describes the various pay codes which make up the complex compensation of employees of the City's Department of Water and Power (DWP). The Category field indicates which column of the DWP Payroll dataset (https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Payroll/DWP-Payroll/fq29-mxsy) that particular pay code relates to.

Pay codes are governed by the Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs) between the DWP and its labor representatives; State, City and Federal law; and Departmental policy.

resource.name: Joint Training Institute (JTI) and Joint Safety Institute (JSI) Credit Card Expenditures
resource.description:
Credit card statements and transaction details for the Joint Safety Institute and the Joint Training Institute. 

Financial documents and underlying data relating to City Controller Ron Galperin's audits of two trusts, the Joint Training Institute and the Joint Safety Institute. The two trusts are fully funded by the Department of Water and Power (DWP) and managed by an appointed board made up of equal numbers of representatives from DWP management and from the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) Local 18, which represents the majority of workers at the DWP. All information below was compiled by the City's auditors for these two audits. For more information, visit: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Audits-and-Reports/Joint-Training-Institute-JTI-and-Joint-Safety-Inst/4i3e-krmq

resource.name: Year Start Reserve Fund Balances
resource.description:
Shows the balance of the City's Reserve Fund, including transfers in and transfers out, beginning in Fiscal Year 1998-1999. The Reserve Fund is an important part of the City's financial health, and is relied on in the event of a natural disaster or other crisis situation.

The City's current policy is to maintain a minimum Reserve Fund balance of 5% of General Fund receipts.
columns_name: Less: Transfer to Budget Stabilization Fund
% Total Reserve Fund to Budgeted General Fund Receipts

resource.name: City Revenue by Month
resource.description: This dataset provides details for Fiscal Year collected revenue by month since Fiscal Year 2012.

resource.name: Neighborhood Council Checking Account Expenditures For Fiscal Year 2017
resource.description:
For expenditures prior to July 1, 2014, please visit this dataset: http://controllerdata.lacity.org/resource/f2ec-m4t9
Beginning in 2014, each Neighborhood Council has been given a checking account as part of a new funding model for NC's. This dataset contains the information about each Neighborhood Council's expenditures from those checking accounts. For more information, see the User Guide here: http://empowerla.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/NC-Checking-Account-Core-Guide-7-1-14-1.pdf

resource.name: Every Animal Counts
resource.description: City Controller Ron Galperin released an audit that indicated the Los Angeles’ Department of Animal Services is making progress toward its goal of making Los Angeles a “No Kill” City. Still, last year about one of every four lost or abandoned animals that entered the City’s shelters were euthanized. View the department's raw data on each of the City's six animal shelters below.

resource.name: Idle Funds
resource.description: Idle Funds are Los Angeles City funds with no expenditures since June 30, 2014, as identified by LA Controller Ron Galperin.
resource.attribution: City of Los Angeles - Office of the Controller

resource.name: Financial Reports & Documents
resource.description: A repository of financial documents, statements and reports relating to all aspects of City operations.

resource.name: City Budget and Expenditures
resource.description: City Budget, Adjustments and Expenditures since Budget Fiscal Year 2012. Financial data is shown by Budget Fiscal Year.
columns_description: Actual cash expense amount
Appropriation account amount net of changes and transfers to/from the original budgeted amount
Increase in appropriation to account by transfer in of funds

Obligation or commitment to pay for a good or service
Decrease in appropriation to account by transfer out of funds

resource.name: Food Resources in California
resource.description: This dataset contains a list of resources such food pantries, food banks, and other food distribution sites throughout the state of California. The data is current as of May 1, 2020. Due to the coronavirus pandemic, many food pantries may change their hours or close temporarily. Please contact a food pantry prior to visiting them to confirm their operating hours and ensure you are in their service area.

resource.name: DWP Audits
resource.description: A database of audits completed by the Internal Audit section of the Department of Water and Power (DWP). These audits are not validated or verified by the Controller's Internal Audit Division, and represent the work of auditors directly employed by the DWP.

resource.name: Debt Cap
resource.description: Provides the total debt cap and approved debt percentage.
resource.attribution: Office of the Controller - City of Los Angeles

resource.name: City of Los Angeles Economic Data
resource.description: Comprehensive economic data for the City of Los Angeles. Prepared by Beacon Economics.
